comedy_styles.name: Wordplay/Puns
comedy_styles.description: Humor based on language and double meanings

comedy_styles.name: Self-Deprecating
comedy_styles.description: Making yourself the target in a relatable way

rule_of_three.description: Two normal items, third breaks the pattern
rule_of_three.example: I need three things: coffee, more coffee, and IV drip of coffee

callback.description: Referencing an earlier joke for cumulative effect
callback.usage: Plant joke early, reference later unexpectedly

misdirection.description: Lead audience one way, surprise them

wordplay.setup: I'm reading a book about anti-gravity.
Why did the scarecrow win an award?
wordplay.punchline: Because he was outstanding in his field!

wordplay.setup: I used to hate facial hair
wordplay.punchline: but then it grew on me.

observational.observation: We have phones that can access all human knowledge, and we use them to argue with strangers and look at cat pictures.
Nothing makes you feel more adult than getting excited about a new sponge.
WiFi going down for 5 minutes feels longer than waiting 5 minutes for dial-up felt in the 90s.

dad_jokes.setup: What do you call a fake noodle?
What did the ocean say to the beach?
I would tell you a construction joke
dad_jokes.punchline: but I'm still working on it.

tech_jokes.setup: Why do programmers prefer dark mode?
A SQL query walks into a bar, goes up to two tables and asks
Why do Java developers wear glasses?

one_liners: I'm not lazy, I'm on energy-saving mode.
I told my suitcase there will be no vacation this year. Now I'm dealing with emotional baggage.
I'm on a seafood diet. I see food and I eat it.
I used to be indecisive. Now I'm not so sure.

recovery_phrases: Well, that one's going in the trash.
I wrote that one myself, can you tell?
This material kills at poetry readings.
Don't worry, I've got more where that came from... unfortunately.
Moving on before security escorts me out...

sad.approach: Empathy first, humor only if invited
